assignments.name: service
probe_summary

parameters.command:
=NS="{{ $json.ns || "guestbook" }}"
APP="{{ $json.app || "guestbook" }}"
TIER="{{ $json.tier || "frontend" }}"
DEPLOY="{{ $json.deploy || "frontend" }}"
SVC="{{ $json.svc || "frontend" }}"

echo "apiVersion: v1"
kubectl -n "$NS" get svc "$SVC" -o yaml

echo '--- ENDPOINTS YAML ---'
kubectl -n "$NS" get endpoints "$SVC" -o yaml

echo '--- DEPLOY YAML ---'
kubectl -n "$NS" get deploy "$DEPLOY" -o yaml

echo '--- REPLICASETS JSON ---'
kubectl -n "$NS" get rs -l app="$APP",tier="$TIER" -o json

echo '--- RS TABLE ---'
kubectl -n "$NS" get rs -l app="$APP",tier="$TIER" \
  -o custom-columns=REVISION:.metadata.annotations."deployment\.kubernetes\.io/revision",NAME:.metadata.name,IMAGE:.spec.template.spec.containers[0].image,READY:.status.readyReplicas \
  --no-headers 2>/dev/null || true

echo '--- POD NAME ---'
kubectl -n "$NS" get pods -l app="$APP",tier="$TIER" \
  -o jsonpath='{.items[0].metadata.name}{"\n"}' 2>/dev/null || echo "<no-pod>"

echo '--- LAST LOGS (tail=120) ---'
POD="$(kubectl -n "$NS" get pods -l app="$APP",tier="$TIER" -o jsonpath='{.items[0].metadata.name}' 2>/dev/null)"
[ -n "$POD" ] && kubectl -n "$NS" logs "$POD" --tail=120 || echo "<no-pod>"

echo '--- LAST EVENTS (10) ---'
kubectl -n "$NS" get events --sort-by=.lastTimestamp | tail -n 10 || true

echo '--- ROLLOUT HISTORY ---'
kubectl -n "$NS" rollout history deploy/"$DEPLOY" || true

assignments.name: ns
deploy_name

values.content:
You are a Kubernetes incident triage assistant. 
Given only the evidence (HealthCheck summary + raw SVC/Endpoints/Deployment YAML, ReplicaSets JSON and table, last pod logs, cluster events, rollout history), infer the most likely root cause and propose a single safe kubectl command that directly mitigates it. 
If there is no safe one-liner fix, return "N/A".

Return only this JSON:
{"class":"<short>","confidence":"<0..1>","summary_en":"<1‚Äì2 sentence summary>","suggestion_cmd":"<kubectl or N/A>","risk":"<low|medium|high>"}

Rules:
- Do not invent names; use values seen in the evidence.
- Prefer the lowest-risk command (e.g., patching a wrong selector, setting a correct image tag, or rolling back) when clearly supported by evidence.
- If evidence is insufficient or the command could be harmful, return "N/A".

assignments.name: confidence
summary

parameters.message:
=üö® Health check failed. Collecting Kubernetes evidence and running diagnosis.
*Incident:* {{ ($node["Prepare Incident Card"].json.incident_id || '').slice(0,3) }}
*AI Summary:* {{$node["Parse AI JSON"].json.summary}}
*AI Suggestion:* `{{$node["Parse AI JSON"].json.suggestion_cmd}}`
Will apply: `{{ $node["Harden Command"].json.cmd }}`
(Risk: {{$node["Parse AI JSON"].json.risk}},
Confidence: {{ Math.round(( $node["Parse AI JSON"].json.confidence || 0 ) * 100) }}%)

parameters.query:
INSERT INTO public.health_history
(incident_id, phase, source, ai_cause, ai_recommendation, ai_confidence, ai_json)
VALUES ($1, 'ai_decision', 'gemini', $2, $3, $4, $5::jsonb)
ON CONFLICT (incident_id, phase) DO UPDATE
SET ai_cause = EXCLUDED.ai_cause,
    ai_recommendation = EXCLUDED.ai_recommendation,
    ai_confidence = EXCLUDED.ai_confidence,
    ai_json = EXCLUDED.ai_json,
    checked_at = NOW();

INSERT INTO public.health_history
(incident_id, phase, source, action, approved, user_id, user_name, channel, message_ts)
VALUES ($1, 'approval', 'slack', $2, $3, $4, $5, $6, $7)
ON CONFLICT (incident_id, phase) DO UPDATE
SET action      = EXCLUDED.action,
    approved    = EXCLUDED.approved,
    user_id     = EXCLUDED.user_id,
    user_name   = EXCLUDED.user_name,
    channel     = EXCLUDED.channel,
    message_ts  = EXCLUDED.message_ts,
    checked_at  = NOW();

INSERT INTO public.health_history
(incident_id, phase, source, action, ok, status_code, status_message, notes)
VALUES ($1, 'execute_fail', 'k8s', 'kubectl', FALSE, $2, $3, $4::jsonb)
ON CONFLICT (incident_id, phase) DO UPDATE
SET ok = EXCLUDED.ok,
    status_code = EXCLUDED.status_code,
    status_message = EXCLUDED.status_message,
    notes = EXCLUDED.notes,
    checked_at = NOW();

INSERT INTO public.health_history
(incident_id, phase, source, action, ok, status_code, status_message, ai_recommendation)
VALUES ($1, 'execute_fix', 'k8s', 'kubectl', TRUE, $2, $3, $4)
ON CONFLICT (incident_id, phase) DO UPDATE
SET ok = EXCLUDED.ok,
    status_code = EXCLUDED.status_code,
    status_message = EXCLUDED.status_message,
    ai_recommendation = EXCLUDED.ai_recommendation,
    checked_at = NOW();

INSERT INTO public.health_history
(incident_id, phase, source, notes)
VALUES ($1, 'evidence_ready', 'gatherlogs', $2)
ON CONFLICT (incident_id, phase) DO UPDATE
SET notes = EXCLUDED.notes, checked_at = NOW();

INSERT INTO public.health_history
(incident_id, phase, source, action, notes)
VALUES ($1, 'manual_resolution', 'slack', 'manual', $2::jsonb)
ON CONFLICT (incident_id, phase) DO UPDATE
SET action = EXCLUDED.action,
    notes = EXCLUDED.notes,
    checked_at = NOW();

INSERT INTO public.health_history
(incident_id, phase, source, action, notes)
VALUES ($1, 'cmd_error', 'pipeline', 'empty_cmd', $2::jsonb)
ON CONFLICT (incident_id, phase) DO UPDATE
SET action = EXCLUDED.action,
    notes  = EXCLUDED.notes,
    checked_at = NOW();

parameters.command: =sh -lc 'kubectl -n ingress-nginx get deploy ingress-nginx-controller >/dev/null 2>&1 && kubectl -n ingress-nginx rollout restart deploy/ingress-nginx-controller || echo "ingress-nginx controller not found, skip"'

parameters.query:
INSERT INTO public.health_history
(incident_id, phase, source, action, notes)
VALUES (
  $1,
  'postfix_sync',
  'workflow',
  'ingress_restart',
  jsonb_build_object(
    'stdout', left($2, 400),
    'stderr', left($3, 400),
    'reason', $4
  )
);

INSERT INTO public.health_history
(incident_id, phase, source, action, ok, notes)
VALUES (
  $1,
  'postfix_sync',
  'workflow',
  'ingress_restart',
  FALSE,
  jsonb_build_object(
    'stdout', left($2, 400),
    'stderr', left($3, 400),
    'reason', $4,
    'exitCode', $5
  )
);
